class circuit_builder.Classical_post_processor

Bases: object

maximum likelihood estimator for the classical algorithm

log_likelihood_fn(p: float, shots: int, positives: int) → float

computes the log likelihood function of p given the number of good trials

Parameters

  • p (float) – current probability

  • shots (int) – number of shots

  • positives (int) – number of good trials

Returns

log likelihood of p

Return type

float

ml_estimation(shots: int, positives: int) → float

function for maximum likelihood estimation

Parameters

  • shots (int) – number of shots

  • positives (int) – number of good trials

Returns

probability with maximum likelihood

Return type

float

class circuit_builder.Post_processor(results: list)

Bases: object

post processor for MLAE

log_likelihood(num_successes: int, shots: int, num_iter: int, theta: float) → float

computes the log likelihood function

Parameters

  • num_successes (int) – number of good states measures

  • shots (int) – number of shots

  • num_iter (int) – number of Grover iterators used

  • theta (float) – current estimated theta

Returns

log likelihood of producing result given theta

Return type

float

ml_estimation(shots: int, estimation_algo=None) → float

computes the maximum likelihood algorithm

Parameters

  • shots (int) – number of shots per trial

  • estimation_algo (_type_, optional) – algorithm for maximum likelihood function. Defaults to None and uses a brute

  • search. (force) –

Returns

theta with maximum likelihood

Return type

float

build the unitary matrices and gates to rotate the memory qubit to the correct causal state

Parameters

sim_params – object containing the simulation parameters

build_initializer_from_kraus(kraus_ops: numpy.ndarray, markov_order: int, past: str)

creating initializer gates just from the kraus operators, by using the Markov order and past sequence

Parameters

  • kraus_ops (np.ndarray) – list of kraus operators

  • markov_order (int) – Markov order of the process

  • past (str) – a certain past sequence

build_oracle()

create the oracle for the quantum circuit

build_phase_shift_operator()

create the phase shift gate for the quantum circuit

build_unitary_from_kraus(kraus_operators: list) → numpy.ndarray

Create unitary matrix from set of kraus operators. Currently, this is only set to alphabet size of 2

Parameters

kraus_operators (list) – list of kraus operators (np.ndarray)

Returns

unitary matrix

Return type

np.ndarray

build_unitary_from_vectors(start_vectors=[], method='polar') → numpy.ndarray

creates the unitary matrix from a set of start vectors created from (Binder et. al., 2017) paper

Parameters

  • start_vectors (list, optional) – set of start vectors. Defaults to [].

  • method (str, optional) – method to fill up the unitary, either by Gram Schmidt or polar decomposition. Defaults to ‘polar’.

Returns

unitary matrix

Return type

np.ndarray

build_unitary_operator()

create Operator class for unitary to use in quantum circuit from defined unitary matrix

run_amplitude_estimation_circuit(depth_range: list, shots: int) → list

run one trial of the quanutm circuit for MLAE

Parameters

  • depth_range (int) – the schedule

  • shots (int) – number of shots per circuit

Returns

list of results, with each elements being [number of grover iterators, number of good results]

Return type

list

set_initializer(sim_params: circuit_builder.Simulation_parameters)

set the correct initializing gate for the experiment

Parameters

sim_params (Simulation_parameters) – object containing simulation parameters

single_run(num_amplifier: int, shots: int, visualize=False) → dict

run one trial of the quantum circuit at a certain number of Grover iterators

Parameters

  • num_amplifier (int) – number of Grover iterators to use

  • shots (int) – number of shots

  • visualize (bool, optional) – option to visualize the quantum circuit. Defaults to False.

Returns

dictionary of the results

Return type

dict

class circuit_builder.Simulation_parameters(sequence: str, memory_size: int, starting_state, sample_size=1, shots=100, method='EIS')

Bases: object

class to contain all the essential parameters for the quantum circuit. A new stochastic process will be build on top of this class

create_depth_list(max_depth: int, power=1) → list

creates the schedule for the experiment

Parameters

  • max_depth (int) – maximum number of Grover iterators to use

  • power (int, optional) – degree of the polynomial scheme. Defaults to 1.

Raises

Exception – invalid method given

Returns

schedule for the experiment

Return type

list
